technical-data.invention-title: POUTRE DE PROTECTION CONTRE LES IMPACTS

address.street: Mitscherlich & Partner Patent- und Rechtsanwälte Sonnenstrasse 33

description.p: The invention concerns an impact guard beam for vehicles, comprising a beam with a hat profile, i.e., with a crown and side flanges, wherein the hat profile has its crown facing outwards and has a connecting element giving at least a central part of the beam a closed cross section.
Document WO 99/20490 discloses a been according to the preamble of claim 1.

Such impact guard beams are used as side impact protection in vehicle doors and as bumper beams. The connecting element can be a short cover or a cover along the entire beam. Without the cover, the beam tends to flatten out when its crown is subjected to impact forces, so that the beam's bending resistance quickly decreases. If the beam has a planar cover, it maintains its profile, resulting in large stresses in the flanges and the cover and increased risk of cracks. Such a beam tends to buckle in the middle.

heading.b: Purpose of the invention and brief description thereof

description.p:
One object of the invention is to improve the energy uptake for a hat beam of the above kind. This is fulfilled when the connecting element has a profile allowing it to lengthen by straightening out when the hat beam's profile opens under impact loads, yet counteracting the hat beam's further opening when the connecting element is straightened out.
The invention is defined by the claims.

heading.b: Detailed description of the depicted and preferred example of the invention

description.p: Figure 1 shows schematically a vehicle door from the outside. It has a supporting inner panel 11, and an impact guard beam 12 of metal, preferably steel, is connected between its ends. The door is shown without its outer panel. The beam 12 has a hat beam profile, as appears from Fig. 2, i.e., it has a central flange 13, two webs 14,15 and two side flanges 16,17. The central flange and the two webs form the crown of the hat beam 13-15, which can be more rounded than shown. The central part of the hat beam has a connecting element in the form of a cover 20 fastened to the side flanges 16,17 by being folded around the flanges, as shown, and possibly also welded or glued to the two flanges or otherwise secured. The cover 20 has a profile longer than the hat beam's opening, being bent into the hat beam. It can have an appearance as shown in Fig. 2, for example.

When the hat beam is subjected to a collision load on its central flange 13, the beam gives way by opening until its cover 20 straightens out and becomes planar. The profile height of the hat beam then diminishes from height H1 in Fig. 1 to height H2 in Fig. 2. The cover presents only slight resistance during this straightening, but when the cover has become planar it presents great resistance through its yield strength and tensile strength and it counteracts further opening of the beam profile. The length and cross section of the cover are adapted so that the cover will normally not break, but rather the hat beam and the cover will be plastically deformed after the cover becomes flat, thereby giving the greatest possible energy uptake. The length of the cover along the beam should be at least 10 cm when it is a single cover, but the cover can cover a major portion of the beam length. The cover is divided in a number of narrow connecting elements placed at a distance from each other over a larger portion of the beam length in order to provide a more uniform deformation regardless of the positioning of the impact load, without the need for a long cover.

Figure 4 shows an alternative design of cover 20. It has a flat part 23 designed to carry a sensor 24 to initiate an airbag. In this way, the sensor is placed inside the hat beam at the middle of its cross section and it will have less risk of sending a false signal, being less exposed to acceleration, e.g., when the door is shut hard, than if it were positioned on a side flange.
The invention is exemplified with an impact guard beam for a vehicle door, but the invention can be used for other impact protection, e.g., bumper beams.

claim.claim-text: Aufprallschutz für Fahrzeuge, der einen Träger (12) mit einem Hutprofil umfasst, d.h. mit einer Krone (13-15) und Seitenflanschen (16-17), wobei das Hutprofil seine Krone nach außen zeigend aufweist und ein Verbindungsteil in der Form einer Abdeckung (20) umfasst, die zumindest einem Mittelteil des Trägers einen geschlossenen Querschnitt verleiht, wobei die Abdeckung (20), die ein Profil länger als die Öffnung des Hutträgers aufweist, in den Hutträger hinein gebogen ist, was es ihr erlaubt durch Glätten länger zu werden, wenn sich das Hutprofil (13-17) unter einer Aufpralllast öffnet, aber dennoch dem weiteren Öffnen des Hutprofils entgegenzuwirken, wenn sie geglättet ist, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Abdeckung (20) über einen größeren Abschnitt der Aufprallschutzlänge in eine Zahl von schmalen Verbindungselementen unterteilt ist, die in einem Abstand voneinander angeordnet sind.
Aufprallschutz gemäß Anspruch 1, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Abdeckung (20) wenigstens 10 cm der Länge des Aufprallschutzes abdeckt.
Aufprallschutz gemäß einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass der Träger (12) einen Seitenaufprallschutz in einer Fahrzeugtür bildet.
Aufprallschutz gemäß Anspruch 2, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Abdeckung (20) einen Sensor (24) trägt, um einen Airbag auszulösen.
Aufprallschutz gemäß Anspruch 1, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass er eine Stoßstange für ein Fahrzeug ist.

Impact guard beam for vehicles, comprising a beam (12) with a hat profile, i.e., with a crown (13-15) and side flanges (16-17), wherein the hat profile has its crown facing outwards and has a connecting piéce in the form of a cover (20) giving at least a central part of the beam a closed cross section,
wherein the cover (20), which has a profile longer than the hat beam's opening, is bent into the hat beam allowing it to lengthen by straightening out when the hat profile (13-17) opens under impact loads yet counteracting the hat profile's further opening when it has been straightened out,
characterised in that
the cover (20) is divided over a larger portion of the impact guard beam length in a number of narrow connecting elements placed at a distance from each other.
Impact guard beam according to claim 1, characterised in that the cover (20) covers at least 10 cm of the impact guard beam's length.
Impact guard beam according to any one of the preceding claims, characterised in that the beam (12) constitutes a side collision protection in a vehicle door.
Impact guard beam according to claim 2, characterised in that the cover (20) carries a sensor (24) to initiate an airbag.
Impact guard beam according to claim 1, characterised in that it is a bumper beam for a vehicle.

Poutre de protection contre des impacts pour des véhicules, comprenant une poutre (12) avec un profil de chapeau, c'est-à-dire avec une couronne (13-15) et des brides latérales (16-17, où le profil de chapeau présente sa couronne orientée vers l'extérieur et présente une pièce de connexion sous la forme d'un couvercle (20) conférant au moins à une partie centrale de la poutre une section transversale fermée, où le couvercle (20), qui a un profil plus long que l'ouverture de la poutre du chapeau, est plié dans la poutre du chapeau en lui permettant de s'allonger en se redressant lorsque le profil de chapeau (13-17) s'ouvre sous des charges d'impact tout en agissant contre une poursuite de l'ouverture du profil de chapeau lorsqu'il a été redressé,
caractérisée en ce que
le couvercle (20) est divisé sur une plus grande portion de la longueur de la poutre de protection contre des impacts en un nombre d'éléments de connexion étroits placés à une distance les uns des autres.
Poutre de protection contre des impacts selon la revendication 1, caractérisée en ce que le couvercle (20) couvre au moins 10 cm de la longueur de la poutre de protection contre les impacts.

Poutre de protection contre des impacts selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, caractérisée en ce que la poutre (12) constitue une protection contre une collision latérale dans une porte de véhicule.
Poutre de protection contre des impacts selon la revendication 2, caractérisée en ce que le couvercle (20) supporte un capteur (24) pour initier un coussin gonflable de sécurité.
Poutre de protection contre des impacts selon la revendication 1, caractérisée en ce que celle-ci est une poutre de pare-chocs pour un véhicule.
